summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center memorandum detailing the timeline and procedures following the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019. It documents the movement of his remains from New York Presbyterian Hospital to the city morgue under the supervision of correctional officers and the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased inmate whose remains are being handled and transported from the hospital to the city morgue.

persons.name: LieutenanU
persons.context: Recipient of the memorandum; requested emergency hospital detail.

persons.name: Officer a
persons.context: Author of the memorandum; responded to the emergency hospital detail and was responsible for watching Epstein's remains.

persons.name: Director of Office of City Medical Examiner (OCME)
persons.context: Communicated with the Institution Duty Officer regarding receiving and transporting Epstein's remains to the city morgue.

persons.name: Institution Duty Officer (IDO)
persons.context: Took command of the detail, coordinated communications with the OCME Director and A/W, and oversaw the transport of remains.

connections.description: Officer a was responsible for watching Epstein's remains at the hospital.

connections.person2: Director of Office of City Medical Examiner (OCME)
connections.description: IDO communicated and coordinated with the OCME Director regarding the transport of Epstein's remains.
IDO took command of the detail that included Officer a.

events.title: Death and Initial Handling of Jeffrey Epstein's Remains
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's remains were at New York Presbyterian Hospital. Correctional officers were detailed to watch the remains, which were then prepared by hospital staff and moved to the hospital morgue.

events.title: Transport of Remains to City Morgue
events.description: Staff from the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner transported Epstein's remains from New York Presbyterian Hospital to the city morgue location.
personsInvolved: Director of Office of City Medical Examiner (OCME)

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein (inmate #76318-054) was deceased and his remains were at New York Presbyterian Hospital on August 10, 2019.
Correctional officers were detailed to guard Epstein's remains at the hospital and during the transfer process.
The Office of the Chief Medical Examiner (OCME) Director was involved in coordinating the receipt and transport of the remains to the city morgue.
The document provides a detailed, minute-by-minute timeline of the official handling of Epstein's body after his death.
The memorandum is a confidential internal government document from the Metropolitan Correctional Center and the Federal Bureau of Prisons.
